Description: Okta warns nearly 5,000 current and former employees that their personal information was exposed after Rightway Healthcare, a third-party vendor was breached.

Author: HelloKitty
Description: Researchers from Rapid7 reveal that the HelloKitty ransomware operation is exploiting the Apache ActiveMQ CVE-2023-46604 vulnerability to breach networks and encrypt devices.
U.S. mortgage lending giant Mr. Cooper suffers a cyberattack that causes the company to shut down IT systems, including access to their online payment portal.

Author: Lazarus Group
Target: Blockchain engineers of a cryptocurrency exchange platform
Description: Researchers from Elastic reveal the details of REF7001, a campaign using a new macOS malware dubbed 'KandyKorn,' targeting blockchain engineers of a cryptocurrency exchange platform.

Author: Crambus (aka OilRig, APT34, MuddyWater)
Description: Researchers from Deep Instinct discover a new campaign from the “MuddyWater” group targeting two Israeli targets.

Author: Soldiers of Solomon
Description: The Pro-Palestinian hackers group ‘Soldiers of Solomon’ claims to have breached the infrastructure of the production plant of Flour Mills Ltd, a multinational company engaged in the processing and marketing of flour and related food products. The threat actors claim to have damaged the production cycle.

Author: Lorentz
Description: The Cogdell Memorial Hospital announces to be experiencing a computer network incident that prevents the hospital from accessing some of its systems and severely limiting the operability of its phone system. The Lorentz ransomware group claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: Pwned
Description: The Spanish branch of Skincare products maker Clinique, a subsidiary of cosmetics giant Estée Lauder, reportedly experiences a significant data breach, with the personal information of over 700,000 customers exposed by a threat actor with the moniker of Pwned.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: An Advarra employee falls victim of a compromise of their phone number and the threat actors from ALPHV/BlackCat claim to have acquired over 120GB+ of confidential data belonging to customers, patients, and current and former employees.
Researchers from Netskope identify a new DarkGate variant delivered via MSI using a loading approach based on Cobalt Strike Beacon’s default shellcode stub.
Decentralized finance protocol Onyx is the victim of a $2.1 million hack.

Author: NoEscape
Description: The NoEscape ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack against Spolzino Termosanitari.
Allied Pilots Association (APA), a labor union representing 15,000 American Airlines pilots, discloses a ransomware attack.
Researchers from Bitsight discover Socks5Systemz, a proxy botnet delivered by PrivateLoader and Amadey.

Target: Android users in Saudi Arabia, Yemen and Azerbaijan
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal that unknown hackers are targeting users in Saudi Arabia, Yemen and Azerbaijan with the CanesSpy spying malware distributed through user-created WhatsApp mods that customize or add new features to the service.
The Associated Press news website (apnews) is hit with a DDoS attack.
The Hilb Group Operating Company (Hilb) files a notice of data breach after learning that an unauthorized party was able to access certain employee email accounts.

Author: hktalent
Description: Researchers from Phylum discover a new set of 48 malicious npm packages in the npm repository with capabilities to deploy a reverse shell on compromised systems.
BHS Physicians Network confirms a breach of a Microsoft Office 365-hosted business email account that was used by a medical assistant.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The ransomware group ALPHV (BlackCat) publishes a first part of exfiltrated data from the Town of Iowa in the state of Louisiana.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: SingularityMD
Description: The Jeffco Public Schools has some data stolen from a threat actor named SingularityMD.

Author: TellYouThePass
Description: Researchers from Arctic Wolf reveal that Internet-exposed Apache ActiveMQ servers are also targeted in TellYouThePass ransomware attacks exploiting the CVE-2023-46604 Vulnerability.

Author: Kinsing AKA Money Libra
Description: Researchers from Aqua Security reveal that the operators of the Kinsing malware are targeting cloud environments with systems vulnerable to "Looney Tunables," a Linux vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-4911 that allows a local attacker to gain root privileges on the system.
Perry Johnson & Associates (PJ&A) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access files stored on the company’s computer network.
Threat actors disrupt internet connectivity in public healthcare institutions in Singapore with distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Summit Health is added in the LockBit 3.0 ransomware group leak site.

Indian IT service provider Infosys discloses that its U.S. unit, Infosys McCamish Systems, was impacted by a cyber security event, resulting in the non-availability of certain applications and systems.
Crystal Run Healthcare tells patients to expect longer wait times than usual amid a cyber incidents affecting some services.
Researchers from McAfee discover a recent AsyncRAT campaign being distributed through a malicious HTML file.
Life Generations Healthcare (LGH) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party temporarily gained access to certain employee email accounts.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: AlohaCare files a notice of data breach after confirming that a vulnerability in the file-transfer program MOVEit resulted in confidential patient information being accessible to an unauthorized party.

Author: NoEscape
Target: Mulkay Cardiology Consultants at Holy Name Medical Center
Description: Mulkay Cardiology Consultants at Holy Name Medical Center (Mulkay) notifies of an incident affecting a total of 79,582 people. The NoEscape ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack, acquiring 60 GB of confidential and personal data on more than 30,000 patients.
Crystal Run Healthcare experiences system issues that are impacting some of its services, resulting in longer than usual wait times, following a cyber attack.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit 3.0 ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to De Gregoris.

BrickLink, an online Lego parts marketplace owned by Lego, is back online after several days of downtime due to a cybersecurity incident that apparently targeted some merchant accounts. The company said it received a “threat and ransom demand”, presumably in regard to company or user data, leading it to shut down the site “out of an abundance of caution.”

Author: Apathy
Description: A threat actor named Apathy hits Rosgosstrakh (Russian: Росгосстрах), Russia’s second-largest insurance company, successfully stealing 400GB of data.
Financial Asset Management Systems (FAMS) files a notice of data breach after discovering that a “network disruption” affected the company’s ability to access certain files on its computer system.

Bitfinex announces to have resolved a minor information security incident after a small portion of the customer support boards was accessed by an individual or group, through the phishing of a customer support agent.

Researchers from ThreatFabric discover a new dropper-as-a-service (DaaS) cybercrime operation named 'SecuriDropper', using a method that bypasses the 'Restricted Settings' feature in Android to install malware on devices and obtain access to Accessibility Services.
Researchers from ThreatFabric discover Zombinder an additional Android malware bypassing the 'Restricted Settings' feature.

Author: Cerber
Description: Researchers from Rapid7 reveal that attackers are exploiting the CVE-2023-22518 vulnerability, a recently patched and critical severity Atlassian Confluence authentication bypass flaw to encrypt victims' files using Cerber ransomware.

Author: BlueNoroff (AKA APT38, Sapphire Sleet, CageyChameleon, and CryptoCore)
Target: Cryptocurrency exchanges, venture capital firms and banks
Description: Researchers from Jamf discover a new campaign by the North Korean-backed BlueNoroff threat group targeting Apple customers with a new macOS malware tracked as ObjCShellz that can open remote shells on compromised devices.

Author: INC
Description: WellLife Network posts a notice informing patients and employees that their IT team discovered a cyberattack in early September. The INC ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: Manufacturing giant Japan Aviation Electronics confirms that its systems are facing a cyberattack that has forced the company to shut down its website. The ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.

Target: Organizations in the education and healthcare sectors
Description: Researchers from Carbon Black observe an uptick of infections involving the Jupyter infostealer.

Author: Hive0127 (AKA UNC2565)
Description: Researchers from IBM discover “GootBot”, a variant of the notorious Gootloader malware.

Target: Government and defense organizations in India
Description: Researchers from Seqrite discover multiple campaigns of the Pakistan-based APT SideCopy, targeting Indian government and defense entities, exploiting the recent WinRAR vulnerability CVE-2023-38831 to deploy AllaKore RAT, DRat and additional payloads.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Medusa
Description: The Canadian Psychological Association (CPA), the primary representative body for psychologists across Canada, allegedly falls victim to a cyberattack by the notorious Medusa ransomware group.

Blue Ridge Electric Membership Corporation (Blue Ridge Energy) files a notice after discovering that a data breach at Meridian, one of Blue Ridge Energy’s vendors, experienced a data security incident.
The Hillman Group files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party gained access to the company’s computer network.

Author: Qilin
Description: Cardiovascular Consultants (CVC Heart) is hit with a Qilin ransomware attack. The threat actors claim to have exfiltrated 205.93 GB of data.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit 3.0 ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Consorzio di Bonifica dell’Emilia Centrale.
Prestige Care files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party accessed the company’s computer network.
The Marina Bay Sands (MBS) luxury resort and casino in Singapore discloses a data breach that impacts personal data of 665,000 customers.
Microsoft removes from its store a fraudulent Ledger Live app for cryptocurrency management after multiple users lost at least $768,000 worth of cryptocurrency assets.

Date Occurred: During the second half of October 2023
Date Discovered: During the second half of October 2023
Description: Russian financial organization Sberbank states in a press release that two weeks ago it faced the most powerful distributed denial of service (DDoS) attack in recent history.
Security and data analytics company Sumo Logic discloses a security breach after discovering that its AWS (Amazon Web Services) account was compromised.

Author: Social Design Agency (SDA), the Institute for Internet Development, and Structura
Target: Individuals in multiple countries in Latin America
Description: The U.S. State Department uncovers an ongoing Russia-funded disinformation campaign across Latin America aimed at undermining support for Ukraine and discrediting the U.S. and NATO.
Country: AR BO BR CL CO CU EC MX PY PE UY VE

Description: The Washington’s State Department of Transportation is hit by a cyberattack that causes a range of issues for local ferries and apps used for maps.
Pharmacy Group of Mississippi files a notice of data breach after discovering that information that had been entrusted to the company was subject to unauthorized access.

Robert W. Baird & Co. Incorporated (Baird) files a notice of data breach after discovering that confidential information that consumers placed in the company’s care was subject to unauthorized access.
CRC Insurance Services (CRC Group) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access information that had been entrusted to the company.
The Pulaski County Public Schools are hit with a ransomware attack.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware group claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Corsica Ferries.

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: The Pro-Russian hacktivists from NoName057(16) launch a DDoS attack against five targets in Italy including a subdomain of the Ministry of Defense, and a primary bank (Credito Cooperativo.)

Author: 'Silent Ransom Group' (SRG) and 'Luna Moth'
Description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation warns that ransomware threat actors are targeting casino servers and use legitimate system management tools to increase their permissions on the network.

Author: Anonymous Sudan?
Description: OpenAI addresses "periodic outages" due to DDoS attacks targeting its API and ChatGPT. The pro-Russia group Anonymous Sudan claims responsibility for the attack.
Researchers from Malwarebytes reveal that a threat actor has been abusing Google Ads to distribute a trojanized version of the CPU-Z tool to deliver the Redline info-stealing malware.

Researchers from Checkmarx say they have been tracking malware intended to infect the computers of developers who work with the popular Python language and have a need to obfuscate their code via a malicious payload named BlazeStealer.
A suspected ransomware attack causes significant disruption to IT systems at Scotland's Western Isles local authority, Comhairle nan Eilean Siar.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Two prominent Chinese government hacking groups
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks reveal that two prominent Chinese government hacking groups are targeting at least 24 Cambodian government organizations through cloud backup services.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: US Radiology Specialists, one of the nation’s largest private radiology companies agrees to pay a $450,000 fine after a 2021 ransomware attack, exploiting the SonicWall CVE-2021-20016 vulnerability, led to the exposure of sensitive information from nearly 200,000 patients.

The US cybersecurity agency CISA issues a warning on threat actors exploiting CVE-2023-29552, a Service Location Protocol (SLP) vulnerability that allows for denial-of-service (DoS) attacks with a high amplification factor.

Author: BlueNoroff (AKA APT38, Sapphire Sleet, CageyChameleon, and CryptoCore)
Description: Microsoft researchers warn of a new social engineering campaign from the BlueNoroff North Korean threat actor, aimed at IT job seekers that relied on a new cluster of bogus skills assessment portals.

Author: Eight individuals
Target: Financial and education institutions, and official government sites in Australia
Description: Police in Malaysia dismantle BulletProof Link, a major phishing-as-a-service (PhaaS) and initial access broker (IAB) operation that supplied thousands of threat actors.

Author: Crambus (aka OilRig, APT34, MuddyWater)
Description: Researchers from Deep Instinct discover a new campaign from the “MuddyWater” group targeting Offtec, a Jordanian conglomerate using MuddyC2Go, a new C2 Framework.

Author: Crambus (aka OilRig, APT34, MuddyWater)
Description: Researchers from Deep Instinct discover a new campaign from the “MuddyWater” group targeting Korek, an Iraqi Telecom provider using MuddyC2Go, a new C2 Framework.

Author: Crambus (aka OilRig, APT34, MuddyWater)
Description: Researchers from Deep Instinct discover a new campaign from the “MuddyWater” group targeting Israel, using MuddyC2Go, a new C2 Framework.
Police in Malaysia dismantle BulletProofLink, a major phishing-as-a-service (PhaaS) and initial access broker (IAB) operation that supplied thousands of threat actors.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Aon discover a stealthy backdoor named Effluence deployed following the successful exploitation of CVE-2023-22515, the recently disclosed security flaw in Atlassian Confluence Data Center and Server.
The Monero Project admits that one of its wallets was drained by an unknown source, losing the equivalent of around $437,000.
Edward C. Taylor, Ph.D. confirms that an unauthorized individual had gained access to its network and exfiltrated files containing company information.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Hopewell Area School District is hit with a Medusa ransomware attack.

Author: Farnetwork
Description: Researchers from Group-IB identify a ransomware operator they call "Farnetwork." associated with the JSWORM, Karma, Nemty, and Nefilim ransomware.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit 3.0 ransomware group successfully encrypts files and also allegedly exfiltrates data from Egyptian e-payment provider Fawry.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit 3.0 ransomware group adds Amber Hill Group the their leak site.

Author: Sandworm
Description: Researchers from Mandiant reveal that Russian state hackers have evolved their methods for breaching industrial control systems by adopting living-off-the-land techniques used for disruptive events in Ukraine.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal that the threat actors from the Clop group are exploiting the CVE-2023-47246 zero-day vulnerability in the service management software SysAid to gain access to corporate servers for data theft and to deploy ransomware.

Author: Anonymous Sudan
Description: Cloudflare is hit by a DDoS attack. The Pro-Russia group Anonymous Sudan claims responsibility for the attack.
Researchers from Huntress warn that hackers are targeting multiple healthcare organizations in the U.S. by abusing the ScreenConnect remote access tool.

Author: Imperial Kitten AKA Tortoiseshell, TA456, Crimson Sandstorm, and Yellow Liderc
Target: Organizations in the transportation, logistics and technology sectors in Israel
Description: Researchers from Crowdstrike reveal the details of a new campaign from Imperial Kitten targeting transportation, logistics, and technology firms in Israel using a novel malware family.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Allen & Overy discloses to have suffered a "data incident", after social media posts suggested it had been hacked by the Lockbit cybercrime gang. According to rumors, the attack was carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-4966 Citrix Bleed vulnerability.

Researchers from ESET discover a new Android spyware called Kamran allegedly distributed through a so-called watering hole attack involving a compromised news website called Hunza News, targeting Urdu speakers in Kashmir.
Researchers from Cisco Talos observe an increase in spam messages abusing a feature of quizzes created within Google Forms.

Researchers from Trend Micro uncover a phishing campaign involving threat actors sending socially engineered emails containing a link to DRACOON.team, a file-sharing solution known for its secure data storage, management, and file-sharing features.
Healix Infusion Therapy (Healix) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access confidential information that had been provided to the company.
Refresco Beverages U.S. files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party accessed portions of the company’s computer network.
Cinfed Federal Credit Union (Cinfed CU) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access portions of the company’s computer system.
The Butte School District is forced to shut down its computer system to investigate an unknown breach of the network that serves all the public schools in the city.

Author: Black Basta
Description: The Black Basta ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Califano Carrelli.
Warren General Hospital (WGH) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unknown actor accessed certain WGH computer systems.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The U.S. branch of the Industrial & Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) confirms its services were disrupted by a ransomware attack that impacted its systems. According to rumors, the attack was carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-4966 Citrix Bleed vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: The State of Maine announces that its systems were breached after threat actors exploited the vulnerability in the MOVEit file transfer tool and accessed personal information of about 1.3 million, which is close to the state's entire population.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Threat actors steal more than $100 million worth of Bitcoin and Ethereum from cryptocurrency trading platform Poloniex.

Date Occurred: Between late August or early September 2023
Description: On-demand moving and delivery platform Dolly.com is hit with a ransomware attack, allegedly pays a ransom but the threat actors find an excuse not to hold their end of the bargain.

Author: DarkCasino
Description: Researchers from NSFOCUS reveal the details of the latest campaign from the DarkCasino threat against online trading platforms exploiting the CVE-2023-38831 WinRAR vulnerability.

Author: Actor230830
Target: Relevant personnel of the European Parliament
Description: Researchers from NSFOCUS reveal that a threat actor marked as Actor230830 launched attacks on relevant personnel of the European Parliament exploiting the CVE-2023-38831 WinRAR vulnerability.

Author: Actor231003
Description: Researchers from NSFOCUS reveal that a threat actor marked as Actor231003 launched attacks against Serbia exploiting the CVE-2023-38831 WinRAR vulnerability to deliver the REMCOS malware.

Author: Actor231004
Description: Researchers from NSFOCUS reveal that a threat actor marked as Actor231004 launched attacks against governmental sectors of New Zealand exploiting the CVE-2023-38831 WinRAR vulnerability to deliver the Bumblebee malware.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Actor231010 AKA SkeletonWolf
Description: Researchers from NSFOCUS reveal that a threat actor marked as Actor231010 launched attacks against Russia and Belarus exploiting the CVE-2023-38831 WinRAR vulnerability to deliver the AthenaAgent malware.

Author: Actor231009
Description: Researchers from NSFOCUS reveal that a threat actor marked as Actor231009 launched attacks against China exploiting the CVE-2023-38831 WinRAR vulnerability to deliver the SmokeLoader malware.
A cyberattack affects operations at Tri-City Medical Center.

Author: DuckTail
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal that the Vietnamese threat actors behind the Ducktail stealer malware have been linked to a new campaign that ran targeting marketing professionals in India with an aim to hijack Facebook business accounts.
Southland Integrated Services (SIS) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party gained access to its computer network.

Acrisure files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized third party gained access to a portion of the company’s computer network. The incident resulted in an unauthorized party being able to access consumers’ sensitive information

Target: International Association of Sheet Metal Air Rail Transportation Workers (“SMART”)
Description: The International Association of Sheet Metal Air Rail Transportation Workers (SMART) files a notice of data breach after discovering that files stored on the company’s network were subject to unauthorized access.
Republic Bank of Chicago (Republic Bank) files a notice of data breach after discovering that sensitive information within the company’s control was subject to unauthorized access.

Date Occurred: Since January 2023 and continuing as recently as October 2023
Author: Agonizing Serpens AKA Agrius, BlackShadow, Pink Sandstorm, and DEV-0022
Target: Organizations in Israel in the education and technology sectors
Description: The Israel Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT) issues an alert about the BiBi wiper malware targeting organizations in Israel in the education and technology sectors. The attacks are attributed to the Iranian APT Agonizing Serpens.

Researcher from Scam Sniffer reveal that malicious actors have been abusing Ethereum's 'Create2' function to bypass wallet security alerts and poison cryptocurrency addresses, which led to stealing $60,000,000 worth of cryptocurrency from 99,000 people in six months.
A ransomware attack on the city of Huber Heights, Ohio, causes significant problems for several city systems.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: 68 hotels in Japan affiliated with Booking.com
Description: 68 hotels in Japan affiliated with Booking.com are hit by a phishing campaign aimed to steal credit card details.

Author: Abnaa AlSaada
Description: The Yemeniti hacktivists from Abnaa AlSaada claim to have hacked Cowboysfarm, an Israeli meat producer.
A threat actor appears to have drained $27 million worth of Tether stablecoins from a crypto wallet tied to Binance.
Researchers from SlowMist discover a campaign targeting individuals in China looking for banned international applications such as Skype.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: CISA warns federal agencies to secure Juniper devices on their networks against four vulnerabilities now used in remote code execution (RCE) attacks as part of a pre-auth exploit chain.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: A cyberattack on international logistics firm DP World Australia severely disrupts the regular freight movement in multiple large Australian ports. According to rumors, the attack was carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-4966 Citrix Bleed vulnerability.

Author: Royal
Description: The FBI and CISA reveal in a joint advisory that the Royal ransomware gang has breached the networks of at least 350 organizations worldwide since September 2022.
Researchers from Ahnlab reveal that MySQL servers are being targeted by the 'Ddostf' malware botnet to enslave them for a DDoS-as-a-Service platform whose firepower is rented to other cybercriminals.

Author: Medusa
Description: Moneris, a technology company created by two of Canada’s largest banks, is listed in the Medusa ransomware gang leak site, despite the company claims it stopped the access to critical data.

Author: UAC-0050
Description: Researchers from the Ukraine Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-UA) discover a new campaign distributing the REMCOS rat via phishing letters to their targets, disguising them as official requests from Ukraine’s security service (SBU).
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The North Carolina Central University (NCCU) experience some disruptions after suffering a cyber attack.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Google announces to be taking legal action against cybercriminals who delivered malware through websites that told users they could download the Google Bard AI tool.

Author: Haimai and Haixun (two Chinese firms)
Description: The National Intelligence Service (NIS), the South Korean spy agency, identifies a network of 38 fake news websites run by Chinese firms Haimai and Haixun operating within the country to influence public opinion.
An online forum user shares a database allegedly stolen from a 3rd party associated with McGraw Hill, which the threat actor claims to contain information from 90,875 users.

Researchers from Cado Security Labs discover a novel campaign targeting publicly-exposed instances of the Docker Engine API to deliver a malicious Docker container, built from an image named “oracleiv_latest” and containing Python malware acting as a Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) bot agent.
Researchers from Sekoia.io discover a targeted campaign using Discord messages and fake download websites to distribute information-stealing malware within the gaming sphere.
Southwest Behavioral Health Center files a notice of data breach after discovering that confidential information that had been provided to the company was subject to unauthorized access.
Recology confirms reports that the company experienced a cyberattack.
Otsego Memorial Hospital suffers a cyber incident.

Author: Hunters International
Description: Homeland is added to the “victim list” of a ransomware group, raising concerns that the company may have experienced a data breach
The West Central District Health Department in Nebraska (WDCHD) confirms to have suffered an unauthorized access to its network and patient data has been exposed.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit 3.0 ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Plati.

Author: Alpha Team
Description: The Alpha Team collective defaces the website of Federpivacy, an Italian Cyber Security organization.
The Henry County Schools in Atlanta warn parents of a cyber incident.
Oregon’s Beaverton School District is hit by a cybersecurity incident.
Bladen County says it became the victims of a cyberattack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: APT29, AKA Cozy Bear or Blue Bravo
Description: The Ukraine’s National Cyber Security Coordination Center (NCSCC) reveals that Russian state-sponsored hackers from APT29 have targeted embassies and international organizations exploiting the WinRAR CVE-2023-38831 vulnerability.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds three Microsoft vulnerabilities, CVE-2023-36033, CVE-2023-36025 and CVE-2023-36036, to its Known Exploited vulnerabilities catalog.

Author: Medusa
Description: Toyota Financial Services Europe & Africa confirms being targeted in a cyberattack, which appears to have been conducted by the Medusa ransomware group exploiting the CVE-2023-4966 CitrixBleed vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Medical Eye Services (MESVision) files a notice of data breach after discovering that MOVEit, a software program used by MESVision, contained a critical vulnerability that gave hackers access to confidential data in the company’s possession.

Author: Kritec
Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes reveal a resurgence of the Kritec web skimming campaign.

Author: TA402 (AKA Molerats, Gaza Cybergang, Frankenstein, WIRTE)
Target: Government organizations in the Middle East and North Africa
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new campaign from the pro-Palestine threat actor named TA402, using a new initial access downloader dubbed IronWind.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: Researchers from eSentire observe the notorious ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang using Google Ads to distribute malware.
The Harris Center for Mental Health falls victim to a ransomware attack.

Author: NoEscape
Description: Southeastern Orthopaedic Specialists is added to the NoEscape ransomware gang leak site. The threat actors claim to have exfiltrated 3 GB of data.

Author: NoEscape
Description: Carespring is added to the NoEscape ransomware gang leak site. The threat actors claim to have exfiltrated 364 GB of data.

Catholic Charities of the Diocese of Rockville Centre, doing business as Catholic Charities of Long Island in New York, notifies 13,000 patients that some of their personal information was exposed and potentially acquired by unauthorized individuals.
A security researcher from the Electronic Frontier Foundation reveals that the Dragon Touch KidzPad Y88X tablet comes infected with the Corejava malware.
Securities America (SAI) files a notice describing a data breach at McCord LLC, an unaffiliated company that registers its financial professionals with SAI.

Target: International Paper Company Group Health and Welfare Plan
Description: International Paper Company Group Health and Welfare Plan (IP Plan) files a notice of data breach, after a cyber incident that resulted in an unauthorized party being able to access consumers’ sensitive information.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: The Medical College of Wisconsin (MCW) confirms that the protected health information of 240,667 individuals was stolen by the Clop hacking group, which exploited the zero day vulnerability in Progress Software’s MOVEit Transfer.
The River Valley School suffers a wire fraud incident, when an outside network of one of the district’s vendors is breached and used to make a fraudulent wire transfer of $736,126.91.
Multiple fake accounts impersonating cryptocurrency scam investigators and blockchain security companies are promoting phishing pages to drain wallets in an ongoing campaign on X (former Twitter).

Author: Rhysida
Description: The FBI and CISA warn of Rhysida ransomware gang's opportunistic attacks targeting organizations across multiple industry sectors.
Samsung Electronics notifies some of its UK customers of a data breach that exposed their personal information to an unauthorized individual.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The AlphV/BlackCat ransomware group adds MeridianLink to its leak site and reports its victim to the Securities Exchange Commission (SEC.)
The Californian City of Long Beach warns that it suffered a cyberattack that led to shut down portions of the IT network to prevent the attack's spread.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The North Muskegon Public Schools in Michigan is forced to cancel school after suffering a "cyber incident."

Author: Multiple groups, likely including Russia’s state-sponsored Sandworm
Description: SektorCERT, Denmark's state-funded organization handling cyber incidents in the critical sector, reveals that 22 energy companies were breached during May 2023, exploiting the CVE-2023-28771 Zyxel vulnerability.

Author: FahriDinerPlume and Panic
Description: The smart Wi-Fi service provider, Plume, apparently falls victim to a data breach. The perpetrators, claiming responsibility for the incident, make their announcement on the notorious Breach Forums.

Author: Snatch
Description: Tyson Foods, the world’s second-largest chicken, beef, and pork processor, is listed among the victims of a Snatch ransomware attack.

Author: Abnaa AlSaada
Description: A threat actor codenamed Abnaa AlSaada, possibly from Yemen, claims to have taken over control of aluminum manufacturing company Profal’s operations.

Author: Play
Description: The Play ransomware group claims to have successfully hit the Donald W. Wyatt Detention Facility.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Google's Threat Analysis Group (TAG) discover a campaign targeting a government organization in Greece, exploiting the CVE-2023-37580 Zimbra email server vulnerability.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Winter Vivern
Target: Government organizations in Moldova and Tunisia
Description: Researchers from Google's Threat Analysis Group (TAG) discover a campaign targeting government organizations in Moldova and Tunisia, exploiting the CVE-2023-37580 Zimbra email server vulnerability.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Google's Threat Analysis Group (TAG) discover a campaign targeting government organization in Vietnam, exploiting the CVE-2023-37580 Zimbra email server vulnerability.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Google's Threat Analysis Group (TAG) discover a campaign targeting government organization in Pakistan, exploiting the CVE-2023-37580 Zimbra email server vulnerability.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Swedish digital rights organization Qurium discovers around 250 cloned websites to drive people to China-linked gambling sites.
Researchers from McAfee discover a new SpyAgent campaign infecting smartphone users in South Korea.

Stanley Steemer International (Stanley Steemer) filed a notice of data breach with the Attorney General of Maine after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access portions of the company’s computer network.
Westside Community Services (Westside Health) file a notice of data breach after discovering that there was unauthorized access to its computer system.
Adams Bank & Trust (ABT) files a notice of data breach after confirming that the bank’s computer system was accessed by an unauthorized party.

Author: Knight
Description: The Knight ransomware group claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Studio D.E.L.L.A..
